intro: Horkelia tenuiloba, commonly known as the slenderleaf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and dry slopes. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Horkelia tenuiloba is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
